content.question: Which of the following may be considered a primary reason that African Americans migrated out of the South?

choices.label: They wanted to participate in the artistic innovations of the New Negro movement.
They sought safety from the dangers of lynching and other racial violence.
They were escaping the hate crimes and race riots of the Red Summer.
They wanted to pursue higher education opportunities at historically Black colleges and universities (HBCUs).

content.answer: They sought safety from the dangers of lynching and other racial violence.
